If this occurs, the receiver buffer contents are preserved, and the incoming data is lost. Data received by the SPI should be considered undefined if RxOv is set.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag. This flag applies only to slave mode (Master = 0). In this case, the transmitter must begin sending new data on the next input clock if the transmitter is idle. If that data is not available in the transmitter holding register at that point, there is no data to transmit and the TXUR flag is set. Data transmitted by the SPI should be considered undefined if TXUR is set.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert. This flag is set whenever any slave select transitions from deasserted to asserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become busy, and allows waking up the device from reduced power modes when a slave mode access begins. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert. This flag is set whenever any asserted slave selects transition to deasserted, in both master and slave modes. This allows determining when the SPI transmit/receive functions become idle. This flag is cleared by software.

field.name: STALLED
field.description: Stalled status flag. This indicates whether the SPI is currently in a stall condition.

field.name: ENDTRANSFER
field.description: End Transfer control bit. Software can set this bit to force an end to the current transfer when the transmitter finishes any activity already in progress, as if the EOT flag had been set prior to the last transmission. This capability is included to support cases where it is not known when transmit data is written that it will be the end of a transfer. The bit is cleared when the transmitter becomes idle as the transfer comes to an end. Forcing an end of transfer in this manner causes any specified FRAME_DELAY and TRANSFER_DELAY to be inserted.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master idle status flag. This bit is 1 whenever the SPI master function is fully idle. This means that the transmit holding register is empty and the transmitter is not in the process of sending data.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable read and Set. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: RXRDYEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available.

enumeratedValue.name: RXRDYEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when receiver data is available in the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRDYEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter holding register is available.

enumeratedValue.name: TXRDYEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when data may be written to TXDAT.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a receiver overrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need for the receiver to move newly received data to the RXDAT register when it is already in use. The interface prevents receiver overrun in Master mode by not allowing a new transmission to begin when a receiver overrun would otherwise occur.

enumeratedValue.name: RXOVEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when a receiver overrun occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: RXOVEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated if a receiver overrun occurs.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when a transmitter underrun occurs. This happens in slave mode when there is a need to transmit data when none is available.

enumeratedValue.name: TXUREN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when the transmitter underruns.

enumeratedValue.name: TXUREN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated if the transmitter underruns.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSAEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSAEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when any Slave Select transitions from deasserted to asserted.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the Slave Select is deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSDEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

enumeratedValue.name: SSDEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when all asserted Slave Selects transition to deasserted.

field.name: MSTIDLEEN
field.description: Determines whether an interrupt occurs when the MSTIDLE enable

enumeratedValue.name: MSTIDLEEN_0
enumeratedValue.description: No interrupt will be generated when MSTIDLE enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: MSTIDLEEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: An interrupt will be generated when MSTIDLE enabled.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: SPI Interrupt Enable Clear. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit in INTENSET to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXOVEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXUREN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSAEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: SSDEN
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bits in the INTENSET register.

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: SPI Receive Data

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: Receiver Data. This contains the next piece of received data. The number of bits that are used depends on the LEN setting in TXCTL / TXDATCTL.

field.name: RXSSEL0_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL0 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL0 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL1_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL1 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL1 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL2_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL2 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL2 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: RXSSEL3_N
field.description: Slave Select for receive. This field allows the state of the SSEL3 pin to be saved along with received data. The value will reflect the SSEL3 pin for both master and slave operation. A zero indicates that a slave select is active. The actual polarity of each slave select pin is configured by the related SPOL bit in CFG.

field.name: SOT
field.description: Start of Transfer flag. This flag will be 1 if this is the first data after the SSELs went from deasserted to asserted (i.e., any previous transfer has ended). This information can be used to identify the first piece of data in cases where the transfer length is greater than 16 bit.

register.name: TXDATCTL
register.description: SPI Transmit Data with Control

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 1 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL0 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL0 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL1 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL1 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL2 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL2 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: TXSSEL3_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select. This field asserts SSEL3 in master mode. The output on the pin is active LOW by default. Remark: The active state of the SSEL3 pin is configured by bits in the CFG register.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer. The asserted SSEL will be deasserted at the end of a transfer, and remain so for at least the time specified by the Transfer_delay value in the DLY register.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_deasserted
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data is not treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will not be deasserted at the end of this data.

enumeratedValue.name: SSEL_not_deasserted
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data is treated as the end of a transfer. SSEL will be deasserted at the end of this piece of data.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame. Between frames, a delay may be inserted, as defined by the FRAME_DELAY value in the DLY register. The end of a frame may not be particularly meaningful if the FRAME_DELAY value = 0. This control can be used as part of the support for frame lengths greater than 16 bits.

enumeratedValue.name: Data_not_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data transmitted is not treated as the end of a frame.

enumeratedValue.name: Data_EOF
enumeratedValue.description: This piece of data is treated as the end of a frame, causing the FRAME_DELAY time to be inserted before subsequent data is transmitted.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore. This allows data to be transmitted using the SPI without the need to read unneeded data from the receiver.Setting this bit simplifies the transmit process and can be used with the DMA.

enumeratedValue.name: Read_received_data
enumeratedValue.description: Received data must be read in order to allow transmission to progress. In slave mode, an overrun error will occur if received data is not read before new data is received.

enumeratedValue.name: Ignore_received_data
enumeratedValue.description: Received data is ignored, allowing transmission without reading unneeded received data. No receiver flags are generated.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data Length. Specifies the data length from 1 to 16 bits. Note that transfer lengths greater than 16 bits are supported by implementing multiple sequential transmits. 0x0 = Data transfer is 1 bit in length. 0x1 = Data transfer is 2 bits in length. 0x2 = Data transfer is 3 bits in length. ... 0xF = Data transfer is 16 bits in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_1
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 1 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_2
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 2 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_3
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 3 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_4
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 4 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_5
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 5 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_6
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 6 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_7
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 7 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_8
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 8 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_9
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 9 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_10
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 10 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_11
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 11 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_12
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 12 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_13
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 13 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_14
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 14 bit in length.

enumeratedValue.name: LEN_15
enumeratedValue.description: Data transfer is 15 bit in length.

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: SPI Transmit Data.

field.name: DATA
field.description: Transmit Data. This field provides from 4 to 16 bits of data to be transmitted.

register.name: TXCTL
register.description: SPI Transmit Control

field.name: TXSSEL0_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 0.

field.name: TXSSEL1_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 1.

field.name: TXSSEL2_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 2.

field.name: TXSSEL3_N
field.description: Transmit Slave Select 3.

field.name: EOT
field.description: End of Transfer.

field.name: EOF
field.description: End of Frame.

field.name: RXIGNORE
field.description: Receive Ignore.

field.name: LEN
field.description: Data transfer Length.

register.name: DIV
register.description: SPI clock Divider

field.name: DIVVAL
field.description: Rate divider value. Specifies how the Flexcomm clock (FCLK) is divided to produce the SPI clock rate in master mode. DIVVAL is -1 encoded such that the value 0 results in FCLK/1, the value 1 results in FCLK/2, up to the maximum possible divide value of 0xFFFF, which results in FCLK/65536.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: SPI Interrupt Status

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: RXOV
field.description: Receiver Overrun interrupt flag.

field.name: TXUR
field.description: Transmitter Underrun interrupt flag.

field.name: SSA
field.description: Slave Select Assert.

field.name: SSD
field.description: Slave Select Deassert.

field.name: MSTIDLE
field.description: Master Idle status flag.

register.name: CFG
register.description: USART Configuration register. Basic USART configuration settings that typically are not changed during operation.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: USART Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART is disabled and the internal state machine and counters are reset. While Enable = 0, all USART interrupts and DMA transfers are disabled. When Enable is set again, CFG and most other control bits remain unchanged. When re-enabled, the USART will immediately be ready to transmit because the transmitter has been reset and is therefore available.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART is enabled for operation.

field.name: DATALEN
field.description: Selects the data size for the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_9
enumeratedValue.description: 9 bit data length. The 9th bit is commonly used for addressing in multidrop mode. See the ADDRDET bit in the CTL register.

field.name: PARITYSEL
field.description: Selects what type of parity is used by the USART.

enumeratedValue.name: EVEN_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Even parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is even, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be even.

enumeratedValue.name: ODD_PARITY
enumeratedValue.description: Odd parity. Adds a bit to each character such that the number of 1s in a transmitted character is odd, and the number of 1s in a received character is expected to be odd.

field.name: STOPLEN
field.description: Number of stop bits appended to transmitted data. Only a single stop bit is required for received data.

enumeratedValue.name: BITS_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 stop bits. This setting should only be used for asynchronous communication.

field.name: CTSEN
field.description: CTS Enable. Determines whether CTS is used for flow control. CTS can be from the input pin, or from the USART's own RTS if loopback mode is enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: No flow control. The transmitter does not receive any automatic flow control signal.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Flow control enabled. The transmitter uses the CTS input (or RTS output in loopback mode) for flow control purposes.

field.name: SYNCEN
field.description: Selects synchronous or asynchronous operation.

field.name: CLKPOL
field.description: Selects the clock polarity and sampling edge of received data in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Falling edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the falling edge of SCLK.

enumeratedValue.name: RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Rising edge. Un_RXD is sampled on the rising edge of SCLK.

field.name: SYNCMST
field.description: Synchronous mode Master select.

enumeratedValue.name: SLAVE
enumeratedValue.description: Slave. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a slave.

enumeratedValue.name: MASTER
enumeratedValue.description: Master. When synchronous mode is enabled, the USART is a master.

field.name: LOOP
field.description: Selects data loopback mode.

enumeratedValue.name: LOOPBACK
enumeratedValue.description: Loopback mode. This provides a mechanism to perform diagnostic loopback testing for USART data. Serial data from the transmitter (Un_TXD) is connected internally to serial input of the receive (Un_RXD). Un_TXD and Un_RTS activity will also appear on external pins if these functions are configured to appear on device pins. The receiver RTS signal is also looped back to CTS and performs flow control if enabled by CTSEN.

field.name: OETA
field.description: Output Enable Turnaround time enable for RS-485 operation.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal deasserted at the end of the last stop bit of a transmission.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. If selected by OESEL, the Output Enable signal remains asserted for one character time after the end of the last stop bit of a transmission. OE will also remain asserted if another transmit begins before it is deasserted.

field.name: AUTOADDR
field.description: Automatic Address matching enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by software. This provides the possibility of versatile addressing (e.g. respond to more than one address).

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. When addressing is enabled by ADDRDET, address matching is done by hardware, using the value in the ADDR register as the address to match.

field.name: OESEL
field.description: Output Enable Select.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RTS signal is used as the standard flow control function.

enumeratedValue.name: RS_485
enumeratedValue.description: RS-485. The RTS signal configured to provide an output enable signal to control an RS-485 transceiver.

field.name: OEPOL
field.description: Output Enable Polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW
enumeratedValue.description: Low. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active low.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: High. If selected by OESEL, the output enable is active high.

field.name: RXPOL
field.description: Receive data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The RX signal is used as it arrives from the pin. This means that the RX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The RX signal is inverted before being used by the USART. This means that the RX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

field.name: TXPOL
field.description: Transmit data polarity.

enumeratedValue.name: STANDARD
enumeratedValue.description: Standard. The TX signal is sent out without change. This means that the TX rest value is 1, start bit is 0, data is not inverted, and the stop bit is 1.

enumeratedValue.name: INVERTED
enumeratedValue.description: Inverted. The TX signal is inverted by the USART before being sent out. This means that the TX rest value is 0, start bit is 1, data is inverted, and the stop bit is 0.

register.name: CTL
register.description: USART Control register. USART control settings that are more likely to change during operation.

field.name: TXBRKEN
field.description: Break Enable.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINOUS
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous break. Continuous break is sent immediately when this bit is set, and remains until this bit is cleared. A break may be sent without danger of corrupting any currently transmitting character if the transmitter is first disabled (TXDIS in CTL is set) and then waiting for the transmitter to be disabled (TXDISINT in STAT = 1) before writing 1 to TXBRKEN.

field.name: ADDRDET
field.description: Enable address detect mode.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The USART presents all incoming data.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The USART receiver ignores incoming data that does not have the most significant bit of the data (typically the 9th bit) = 1. When the data MSB bit = 1, the receiver treats the incoming data normally, generating a received data interrupt. Software can then check the data to see if this is an address that should be handled. If it is, the ADDRDET bit is cleared by software and further incoming data is handled normally.

field.name: TXDIS
field.description: Transmit Disable.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Not disabled. USART transmitter is not disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART transmitter is disabled after any character currently being transmitted is complete. This feature can be used to facilitate software flow control.

field.name: CC
field.description: Continuous Clock generation. By default, SCLK is only output while data is being transmitted in synchronous mode.

enumeratedValue.name: CLOCK_ON_CHARACTER
enumeratedValue.description: Clock on character. In synchronous mode, SCLK cycles only when characters are being sent on Un_TXD or to complete a character that is being received.

enumeratedValue.name: CONTINOUS_CLOCK
enumeratedValue.description: Continuous clock. SCLK runs continuously in synchronous mode, allowing characters to be received on Un_RxD independently from transmission on Un_TXD).

field.name: CLRCCONRX
field.description: Clear Continuous Clock.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on the CC bit.

enumeratedValue.name: AUTO_CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Auto-clear. The CC bit is automatically cleared when a complete character has been received. This bit is cleared at the same time.

field.name: AUTOBAUD
field.description: Autobaud enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. USART is in normal operating mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. USART is in autobaud mode. This bit should only be set when the USART receiver is idle. The first start bit of RX is measured and used the update the BRG register to match the received data rate. AUTOBAUD is cleared once this process is complete, or if there is an AERR.

register.name: STAT
register.description: USART Status register. The complete status value can be read here. Writing ones clears some bits in the register. Some bits can be cleared by writing a 1 to them.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag. When 1, indicates that data is available to be read from the receiver buffer. Cleared after a read of the RXDAT or RXDATSTAT registers.

field.name: RXIDLE
field.description: Receiver Idle. When 0, indicates that the receiver is currently in the process of receiving data. When 1, indicates that the receiver is not currently in the process of receiving data.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag. When 1, this bit indicates that data may be written to the transmit buffer. Previous data may still be in the process of being transmitted. Cleared when data is written to TXDAT. Set when the data is moved from the transmit buffer to the transmit shift register.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter Idle. When 0, indicates that the transmitter is currently in the process of sending data.When 1, indicate that the transmitter is not currently in the process of sending data.

field.name: CTS
field.description: This bit reflects the current state of the CTS signal, regardless of the setting of the CTSEN bit in the CFG register. This will be the value of the CTS input pin unless loopback mode is enabled.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state is detected for the CTS flag above. This bit is cleared by software.

field.name: TXDISSTAT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag. When 1, this bit indicates that the USART transmitter is fully idle after being disabled via the TXDIS in the CTL register (TXDIS = 1).

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a new character is received while the receiver buffer is still in use. If this occurs, the newly received character in the shift register is lost.

field.name: RXBRK
field.description: Received Break. This bit reflects the current state of the receiver break detection logic. It is set when the Un_RXD pin remains low for 16 bit times. Note that FRAMERRINT will also be set when this condition occurs because the stop bit(s) for the character would be missing. RXBRK is cleared when the Un_RXD pin goes high.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.Cleared by software.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input. Its purpose is primarily to allow wake-up from Deep-sleep or Power-down mode immediately when a start is detected. Cleared by software.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a character is received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag. This flag is set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag. Three samples of received data are taken in order to determine the value of each received data bit, except in synchronous mode. This acts as a noise filter if one sample disagrees. This flag is set when a received data bit contains one disagreeing sample. This could indicate line noise, a baud rate or character format mismatch, or loss of synchronization during data reception.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Autobaud Error. An autobaud error can occur if the BRG counts to its limit before the end of the start bit that is being measured, essentially an autobaud time-out.

register.name: INTENSET
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set register. Contains an individual interrupt enable bit for each potential USART interrupt. A complete value may be read from this register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes that bit to be set.

field.name: RXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a received character available to be read from the RXDAT register.

field.name: TXRDYEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the TXDAT register is available to take another character to transmit.

field.name: TXIDLEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter becomes idle (TXIDLE = 1).

field.name: DELTACTSEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when there is a change in the state of the CTS input.

field.name: TXDISEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when the transmitter is fully disabled as indicated by the TXDISINT flag in STAT. See description of the TXDISINT bit for details.

field.name: OVERRUNEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an overrun error occurred.

field.name: DELTARXBRKEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a change of state has occurred in the detection of a received break condition (break condition asserted or deasserted).

field.name: STARTEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a received start bit has been detected.

field.name: FRAMERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a framing error has been detected.

field.name: PARITYERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when a parity error has been detected.

field.name: RXNOISEEN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when noise is detected.

field.name: ABERREN
field.description: When 1, enables an interrupt when an autobaud error occurs.

register.name: INTENCLR
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear register. Allows clearing any combination of bits in the INTENSET register. Writing a 1 to any implemented bit position causes the corresponding bit to be cleared.

field.name: RXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXRDYCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXIDLECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DELTACTSCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: TXDISINTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: OVERRUNCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: DELTARXBRKCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: STARTCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: FRAMERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: PARITYERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: RXNOISECLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

field.name: ABERRCLR
field.description: Writing 1 clears the corresponding bit in the INTENSET register.

register.name: RXDAT
register.description: Receiver Data register. Contains the last character received.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

register.name: RXDATSTAT
register.description: Receiver Data with Status register. Combines the last character received with the current USART receive status. Allows DMA or software to recover incoming data and status together.

field.name: RXDAT
field.description: The USART Receiver Data register contains the next received character. The number of bits that are relevant depends on the USART configuration settings.

field.name: FRAMERR
field.description: Framing Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will set when the character in RXDAT was received with a missing stop bit at the expected location. This could be an indication of a baud rate or configuration mismatch with the transmitting source.

field.name: PARITYERR
field.description: Parity Error status flag. This bit is valid when there is a character to be read in the RXDAT register and reflects the status of that character. This bit will be set when a parity error is detected in a received character.

field.name: RXNOISE
field.description: Received Noise flag.

register.name: TXDAT
register.description: Transmit Data register. Data to be transmitted is written here.

field.name: TXDAT
field.description: Writing to the USART Transmit Data Register causes the data to be transmitted as soon as the transmit shift register is available and any conditions for transmitting data are met: CTS low (if CTSEN bit = 1), TXDIS bit = 0.

register.name: BRG
register.description: Baud Rate Generator register. 16-bit integer baud rate divisor value.

field.name: BRGVAL
field.description: This value is used to divide the USART input clock to determine the baud rate, based on the input clock from the FRG. 0 = FCLK is used directly by the USART function. 1 = FCLK is divided by 2 before use by the USART function. 2 = FCLK is divided by 3 before use by the USART function. 0xFFFF = FCLK is divided by 65,536 before use by the USART function.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status register. Reflects interrupts that are currently enabled.

field.name: RXRDY
field.description: Receiver Ready flag.

field.name: TXRDY
field.description: Transmitter Ready flag.

field.name: TXIDLE
field.description: Transmitter idle status.

field.name: DELTACTS
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of the CTS input is detected.

field.name: TXDISINT
field.description: Transmitter Disabled Interrupt flag.

field.name: OVERRUNINT
field.description: Overrun Error interrupt flag.

field.name: DELTARXBRK
field.description: This bit is set when a change in the state of receiver break detection occurs.

field.name: START
field.description: This bit is set when a start is detected on the receiver input.

field.name: FRAMERRINT
field.description: Framing Error interrupt flag.

field.name: PARITYERRINT
field.description: Parity Error interrupt flag.

field.name: RXNOISEINT
field.description: Received Noise interrupt flag.

field.name: ABERR
field.description: Autobaud Error flag.

register.name: OSR
register.description: Oversample selection register for asynchronous communication.

field.name: OSRVAL
field.description: Oversample Selection Value. 0 to 3 = not supported 0x4 = 5 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0x5 = 6 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit. 0xF= 16 function clocks are used to transmit and receive each data bit.

register.name: ADDR
register.description: Address register for automatic address matching.

field.name: ADDRESS
field.description: 8-bit address used with automatic address matching. Used when address detection is enabled (ADDRDET in CTL = 1) and automatic address matching is enabled (AUTOADDR in CFG = 1).

register.name: MODE
register.description: CRC mode register

field.name: CRC_POLY
field.description: CRC polynomial: 1X = CRC-32 polynomial 01 = CRC-16 polynomial 00 = CRC-CCITT polynomial

field.name: BIT_RVS_WR
field.description: Data bit order: 1 = Bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte) 0 = No bit order reverse for CRC_WR_DATA (per byte)

field.name: CMPL_WR
field.description: Data complement: 1 = 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA 0 = No 1's complement for CRC_WR_DATA

field.name: BIT_RVS_SUM
field.description: CRC sum bit order: 1 = Bit order reverse for CRC_SUM 0 = No bit order reverse for CRC_SUM

field.name: CMPL_SUM
field.description: CRC sum complement: 1 = 1's complement for CRC_SUM 0 = No 1's complement for CRC_SUM

register.name: SEED
register.description: CRC seed register

field.name: CRC_SEED
field.description: A write access to this register will load CRC seed value to CRC_SUM register with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-processes. A write access to this register will overrule the CRC calculation in progresses.

register.name: SUM
register.description: CRC checksum register

field.name: CRC_SUM
field.description: The most recent CRC sum can be read through this register with selected bit order and 1's complement post-processes.

register.name: WR_DATA
register.description: CRC data register

field.name: CRC_WR_DATA
field.description: Data written to this register will be taken to perform CRC calculation with selected bit order and 1's complement pre-process. Any write size 8, 16 or 32-bit are allowed and accept back-to-back transactions.

register.name: CONFIG
register.description: SCT configuration register

field.name: UNIFY
field.description: SCT operation

enumeratedValue.name: DUAL_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as two 16-bit counters named COUNTER_L and COUNTER_H.

enumeratedValue.name: UNIFIED_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: The SCT operates as a unified 32-bit counter.

field.name: CLKMODE
field.description: SCT clock mode

enumeratedValue.name: SYSTEM_CLOCK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: System Clock Mode. The system clock clocks the entire SCT module including the counter(s) and counter prescalers.

enumeratedValue.name: SAMPLED_SYSTEM_CLOCK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Sampled System Clock Mode. The system clock clocks the SCT module, but the counter and prescalers are only enabled to count when the designated edge is detected on the input selected by the CKSEL field. The minimum pulse width on the selected clock-gate input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the high-performance, sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: SCT_INPUT_CLOCK_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: SCT Input Clock Mode. The input/edge selected by the CKSEL field clocks the SCT module, including the counters and prescalers, after first being synchronized to the system clock. The minimum pulse width on the clock input is 1 bus clock period. This mode is the low-power, sampled-clock mode.

enumeratedValue.name: ASYNCHRONOUS_MODE
enumeratedValue.description: Asynchronous Mode. The entire SCT module is clocked directly by the input/edge selected by the CKSEL field. In this mode, the SCT outputs are switched synchronously to the SCT input clock - not the system clock. The input clock rate must be at least half the system clock rate and can be the same or faster than the system clock.

field.name: CKSEL
field.description: SCT clock select. The specific functionality of the designated input/edge is dependent on the CLKMODE bit selection in this register.

field.name: NORELAOD_L
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the lower match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Setting this bit eliminates the need to write to the reload registers MATCHREL if the match values are fixed. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: NORELOAD_H
field.description: A 1 in this bit prevents the higher match registers from being reloaded from their respective reload registers. Setting this bit eliminates the need to write to the reload registers MATCHREL if the match values are fixed. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: INSYNC
field.description: Synchronization for input N (bit 9 = input 0, bit 10 = input 1,, bit 12 = input 3); all other bits are reserved. A 1 in one of these bits subjects the corresponding input to synchronization to the SCT clock, before it is used to create an event. If an input is known to already be synchronous to the SCT clock, this bit may be set to 0 for faster input response. (Note: The SCT clock is the system clock for CKMODEs 0-2. It is the selected, asynchronous SCT input clock for CKMODE3). Note that the INSYNC field only affects inputs used for event generation. It does not apply to the clock input specified in the CKSEL field.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_L
field.description: A one in this bit causes a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in unidirectional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit applies to both the higher and lower registers when the UNIFY bit is set.

field.name: AUTOLIMIT_H
field.description: A one in this bit will cause a match on match register 0 to be treated as a de-facto LIMIT condition without the need to define an associated event. As with any LIMIT event, this automatic limit causes the counter to be cleared to zero in unidirectional mode or to change the direction of count in bi-directional mode. Software can write to set or clear this bit at any time. This bit is not used when the UNIFY bit is set.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: SCT control register

field.name: DOWN_L
field.description: This bit is 1 when the L or unified counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter is counting up, counter limit occurs, and BIDIR = 1.Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_L
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the L or unified counter does not run, but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If a designated start event occurs, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_L
field.description: When this bit is 1, the L or unified counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_L bit is one, the STOP_L bit is cleared. It is possible to remove the halt condition while keeping the SCT in the stop condition (not running) with a single write to this register to simultaneously clear the HALT bit and set the STOP bit. Once set, only software can clear this bit to restore counter operation. This bit is set on reset.

field.name: CLRCTR_L
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the L or unified counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_L
field.description: L or unified counter direction select

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: Up. The counter counts up to a limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Up-down. The counter counts up to a limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_L
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the L or unified counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRE_L+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

field.name: DOWN_H
field.description: This bit is 1 when the H counter is counting down. Hardware sets this bit when the counter is counting, a counter limit condition occurs, and BIDIR is 1. Hardware clears this bit when the counter is counting down and a limit condition occurs or when the counter reaches 0.

field.name: STOP_H
field.description: When this bit is 1 and HALT is 0, the H counter does not, run but I/O events related to the counter can occur. If such an event matches the mask in the Start register, this bit is cleared and counting resumes.

field.name: HALT_H
field.description: When this bit is 1, the H counter does not run and no events can occur. A reset sets this bit. When the HALT_H bit is one, the STOP_H bit is cleared. It is possible to remove the halt condition while keeping the SCT in the stop condition (not running) with a single write to this register to simultaneously clear the HALT bit and set the STOP bit. Once set, this bit can only be cleared by software to restore counter operation. This bit is set on reset.

field.name: CLRCTR_H
field.description: Writing a 1 to this bit clears the H counter. This bit always reads as 0.

field.name: BIDIR_H
field.description: Direction select

enumeratedValue.name: UP
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit condition, then is cleared to zero.

enumeratedValue.name: UP_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: The H counter counts up to its limit, then counts down to a limit condition or to 0.

field.name: PRE_H
field.description: Specifies the factor by which the SCT clock is prescaled to produce the H counter clock. The counter clock is clocked at the rate of the SCT clock divided by PRELH+1. Clear the counter (by writing a 1 to the CLRCTR bit) whenever changing the PRE value.

register.name: LIMIT
register.description: SCT limit event select register

field.name: LIMMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the L or unified counter (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: LIMMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n is used as a counter limit for the H counter (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

register.name: HALT
register.description: SCT halt event select register

field.name: HALTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: HALTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the HALT_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

register.name: STOP
register.description: SCT stop event select register

field.name: STOPMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: STOPMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n sets the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

register.name: START
register.description: SCT start event select register

field.name: STARTMSK_L
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_L bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: STARTMSK_H
field.description: If bit n is one, event n clears the STOP_H bit in the CTRL register (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

register.name: COUNT
register.description: SCT counter register

field.name: CTR_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit L counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

field.name: CTR_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit H counter value. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit unified counter.

register.name: STATE
register.description: SCT state register

field.name: STATE_L
field.description: State variable.

field.name: STATE_H
field.description: State variable.

register.name: INPUT
register.description: SCT input register

field.name: AIN0
field.description: Input 0 state. Input 0 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN1
field.description: Input 1 state. Input 1 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN2
field.description: Input 2 state. Input 2 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: AIN3
field.description: Input 3 state. Input 3 state on the last SCT clock edge.

field.name: SIN0
field.description: Input 0 state. Input 0 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN1
field.description: Input 1 state. Input 1 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN2
field.description: Input 2 state. Input 2 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

field.name: SIN3
field.description: Input 3 state. Input 3 state following the synchronization specified by INSYNC.

register.name: REGMODE
register.description: SCT match/capture mode register

field.name: REGMOD_L
field.description: Each bit controls one match/capture register (register 0 = bit 0, register 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT. 0 = register operates as match register. 1 = register operates as capture register.

field.name: REGMOD_H
field.description: Each bit controls one match/capture register (register 0 = bit 16, register 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT. 0 = register operates as match registers. 1 = register operates as capture registers.

register.name: OUTPUT
register.description: SCT output register

field.name: OUT
field.description: Writing a 1 to bit n forces the corresponding output HIGH. Writing a 0 forces the corresponding output LOW (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of outputs in this SCT.

register.name: OUTPUTDIRCTRL
register.description: SCT output counter direction control register

field.name: SETCLR0
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 0. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR1
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 1. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR2
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 2. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR3
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 3. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR4
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 4. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

field.name: SETCLR5
field.description: Set/clear operation on output 5. Value 0x3 is reserved. Do not program this value.

enumeratedValue.name: INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear do not depend on the direction of any counter.

enumeratedValue.name: L_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter L or the unified counter is counting down.

enumeratedValue.name: H_REVERSED
enumeratedValue.description: Set and clear are reversed when counter H is counting down. Do not use if UNIFY = 1.

register.name: RES
register.description: SCT conflict resolution register

field.name: O0RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 0.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR0 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR0 field).

field.name: O1RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 1.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR1 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR1 field).

field.name: O2RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 2.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR2 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output n (or set based on the SETCLR2 field).

field.name: O3RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 3.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR3 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR3 field).

field.name: O4RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 4.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR4 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR4 field).

field.name: O5RES
field.description: Effect of simultaneous set and clear on output 5.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set output (or clear based on the SETCLR5 field in the OUTPUTDIRCTRL register).

enumeratedValue.name: CLEAR
enumeratedValue.description: Clear output (or set based on the SETCLR5 field).

register.name: DMA0REQUEST
register.description: SCT DMA request 0 register

field.name: DEV_0
field.description: If bit n is one, event n triggers DMA request 0 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: DRL0
field.description: A 1 in this bit triggers DMA request 0 when it loads the MATCH_L/Unified registers from the RELOAD_L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ0
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 0. Note that if the related DMA channel is enabled and properly set up, it is unlikely that software will see this flag, it will be cleared rapidly by the DMA service. The flag remaining set could point to an issue with DMA setup.

register.name: DMA1REQUEST
register.description: SCT DMA request 1 register

field.name: DEV_1
field.description: If bit n is one, event n triggers DMA request 1 (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

field.name: DRL1
field.description: A 1 in this bit triggers DMA request 1 when it loads the Match L/Unified registers from the Reload L/Unified registers.

field.name: DRQ1
field.description: This read-only bit indicates the state of DMA Request 1. Note that if the related DMA channel is enabled and properly set up, it is unlikely that software will see this flag, it will be cleared rapidly by the DMA service. The flag remaining set could point to an issue with DMA setup.

register.name: EVEN
register.description: SCT event interrupt enable register

field.name: IEN
field.description: The SCT requests an interrupt when bit n of this register and the event flag register are both one (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

register.name: EVFLAG
register.description: SCT event flag register

field.name: FLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if event n has occurred since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of events in this SCT.

register.name: CONEN
register.description: SCT conflict interrupt enable register

field.name: NCEN
field.description: The SCT requests an interrupt when bit n of this register and the SCT conflict flag register are both one (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of outputs in this SCT.

register.name: CONFLAG
register.description: SCT conflict flag register

field.name: NCFLAG
field.description: Bit n is one if a no-change conflict event occurred on output n since reset or a 1 was last written to this bit (output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of outputs in this SCT.

field.name: BUSERRL
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR L/Unified, STATE L/Unified, MATCH L/Unified, or the Output register when the L/U counter was not halted. A word write to certain L and H registers can be half successful and half unsuccessful.

field.name: BUSERRH
field.description: The most recent bus error from this SCT involved writing CTR H, STATE H, MATCH H, or the Output register when the H counter was not halted.

register.name: SCTCAP0
register.description: SCT capture register of capture channel

field.name: CAPn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

field.name: CAPn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

register.name: SCTMATCH0
register.description: SCT match value register of match channels

field.name: MATCHn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the L counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

field.name: MATCHn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the H counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

register.name: SCTCAP1
register.description: SCT capture register of capture channel

field.name: CAPn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

field.name: CAPn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

register.name: SCTMATCH1
register.description: SCT match value register of match channels

field.name: MATCHn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the L counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

field.name: MATCHn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read or write the 16-bit value to be compared to the H counter. When UNIFY = 1, read or write the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be compared to the unified counter.

register.name: SCTCAP2
register.description: SCT capture register of capture channel

field.name: CAPn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

field.name: CAPn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, read the 16-bit counter value at which this register was last captured. When UNIFY = 1, read the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value at which this register was last captured.

register.name: SCTCAPCTRL0
register.description: SCT capture control register

field.name: CAPCONn_L
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_L (UNIFY = 0) or the CAPn (UNIFY = 1) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

field.name: CAPCONn_H
field.description: If bit m is one, event m causes the CAPn_H (UNIFY = 0) register to be loaded (event 0 = bit 16, event 1 = bit 17, etc.). The number of bits = number of match/captures in this SCT.

register.name: SCTMATCHREL0
register.description: SCT match reload value register

field.name: RELOADn_L
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn_L register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the lower 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.

field.name: RELOADn_H
field.description: When UNIFY = 0, specifies the 16-bit to be loaded into the MATCHn_H register. When UNIFY = 1, specifies the upper 16 bits of the 32-bit value to be loaded into the MATCHn register.
