register.name: STATE
register.description: SCT event state register 0

field.name: STATEMSKn
field.description: If bit m is one, event n happens in state m of the counter selected by the HEVENT bit (n = event number, m = state number; state 0 = bit 0, state 1= bit 1, etc.). The number of bits = number of states in this SCT.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: SCT event control register 0

field.name: MATCHSEL
field.description: Selects the Match register associated with this event (if any). A match can occur only when the counter selected by the HEVENT bit is running.

field.name: HEVENT
field.description: Select L/H counter. Do not set this bit if UNIFY = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: L_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the L state and the L match register selected by MATCHSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: H_COUNTER
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the H state and the H match register selected by MATCHSEL.

field.name: OUTSEL
field.description: Input/output select

enumeratedValue.name: INPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the inputs selected by IOSEL.

enumeratedValue.name: OUTPUT
enumeratedValue.description: Selects the outputs selected by IOSEL.

field.name: IOSEL
field.description: Selects the input or output signal number associated with this event (if any). Do not select an input in this register if CKMODE is 1x. In this case the clock input is an implicit ingredient of every event.

field.name: IOCOND
field.description: Selects the I/O condition for event n. (The detection of edges on outputs lag the conditions that switch the outputs by one SCT clock). In order to guarantee proper edge/state detection, an input must have a minimum pulse width of at least one SCT clock period .

field.name: COMBMODE
field.description: Selects how the specified match and I/O condition are used and combined.

enumeratedValue.name: OR
enumeratedValue.description: OR. The event occurs when either the specified match or I/O condition occurs.

enumeratedValue.name: MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: MATCH. Uses the specified match only.

enumeratedValue.name: IO
enumeratedValue.description: IO. Uses the specified I/O condition only.

enumeratedValue.name: AND
enumeratedValue.description: AND. The event occurs when the specified match and I/O condition occur simultaneously.

field.name: STATELD
field.description: This bit controls how the STATEV value modifies the state selected by HEVENT when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state.

enumeratedValue.name: ADD
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is added into STATE (the carry-out is ignored).

enumeratedValue.name: LOAD
enumeratedValue.description: STATEV value is loaded into STATE.

field.name: STATEV
field.description: This value is loaded into or added to the state selected by HEVENT, depending on STATELD, when this event is the highest-numbered event occurring for that state. If STATELD and STATEV are both zero, there is no change to the STATE value.

field.name: MATCHMEM
field.description: If this bit is one and the COMBMODE field specifies a match component to the triggering of this event, then a match is considered to be active whenever the counter value is GREATER THAN OR EQUAL TO the value specified in the match register when counting up, LESS THEN OR EQUAL TO the match value when counting down. If this bit is zero, a match is only be active during the cycle when the counter is equal to the match value.

field.name: DIRECTION
field.description: Direction qualifier for event generation. This field only applies when the counters are operating in BIDIR mode. If BIDIR = 0, the SCT ignores this field. Value 0x3 is reserved.

enumeratedValue.name: DIRECTION_INDEPENDENT
enumeratedValue.description: Direction independent. This event is triggered regardless of the count direction.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_UP
enumeratedValue.description: Counting up. This event is triggered only during up-counting when BIDIR = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: COUNTING_DOWN
enumeratedValue.description: Counting down. This event is triggered only during down-counting when BIDIR = 1.

register.name: SET
register.description: SCT output 0 set register

field.name: SET
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to set output n (or clear it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) output 0 = bit 0, output 1 = bit 1, etc. The number of bits = number of events in this SCT. When the counter is used in bi-directional mode, it is possible to reverse the action specified by the output set and clear registers when counting down, See the OUTPUTCTRL register.

register.name: CLR
register.description: SCT output 0 clear register

field.name: CLR
field.description: A 1 in bit m selects event m to clear output n (or set it if SETCLRn = 0x1 or 0x2) event 0 = bit 0, event 1 = bit 1, etc. The number of bits = number of events in this SCT. When the counter is used in bi-directional mode, it is possible to reverse the action specified by the output set and clear registers when counting down, See the OUTPUTCTRL register.

register.name: CTRL
register.description: DMA control.

field.name: ENABLE
field.description: DMA controller master enable.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. The DMA controller is disabled. This clears any triggers that were asserted at the point when disabled, but does not prevent re-triggering when the DMA controller is re-enabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. The DMA controller is enabled.

register.name: INTSTAT
register.description: Interrupt status.

field.name: ACTIVEINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any enabled interrupts (other than error interrupts) are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No enabled interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one enabled interrupt is pending.

field.name: ACTIVEERRINT
field.description: Summarizes whether any error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Not pending. No error interrupts are pending.

enumeratedValue.name: PENDING
enumeratedValue.description: Pending. At least one error interrupt is pending.

register.name: SRAMBASE
register.description: SRAM address of the channel configuration table.

field.name: OFFSET
field.description: Address bits 31:9 of the beginning of the DMA descriptor table. For 18 channels, the table must begin on a 512 byte boundary.

register.name: ENABLESET0
register.description: Channel Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: ENA
field.description: Enable for DMA channels. Bit n enables or disables DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = disabled. 1 = enabled.

register.name: ENABLECLR0
register.description: Channel Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears the corresponding bits in ENABLESET0. Bit n clears the channel enable bit n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved.

register.name: ACTIVE0
register.description: Channel Active status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ACT
field.description: Active flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = not active. 1 = active.

register.name: BUSY0
register.description: Channel Busy status for all DMA channels.

field.name: BSY
field.description: Busy flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = not busy. 1 = busy.

register.name: ERRINT0
register.description: Error Interrupt status for all DMA channels.

field.name: ERR
field.description: Error Interrupt flag for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = error interrupt is not active. 1 = error interrupt is active.

register.name: INTENSET0
register.description: Interrupt Enable read and Set for all DMA channels.

field.name: INTEN
field.description: Interrupt Enable read and set for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = interrupt for DMA channel is disabled. 1 = interrupt for DMA channel is enabled.

register.name: INTENCLR0
register.description: Interrupt Enable Clear for all DMA channels.

field.name: CLR
field.description: Writing ones to this register clears corresponding bits in the INTENSET0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved.

register.name: INTA0
register.description: Interrupt A status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IA
field.description: Interrupt A status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt A is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt A is active.

register.name: INTB0
register.description: Interrupt B status for all DMA channels.

field.name: IB
field.description: Interrupt B status for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = the DMA channel interrupt B is not active. 1 = the DMA channel interrupt B is active.

register.name: SETVALID0
register.description: Set ValidPending control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: SV
field.description: SETVALID control for DMA channel n. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the VALIDPENDING control bit for DMA channel n

register.name: SETTRIG0
register.description: Set Trigger control bits for all DMA channels.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Set Trigger control bit for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. The number of bits = number of DMA channels in this device. Other bits are reserved. 0 = no effect. 1 = sets the TRIG bit for DMA channel n.

register.name: ABORT0
register.description: Channel Abort control for all DMA channels.

field.name: ABORTCTRL
field.description: Abort control for DMA channel 0. Bit n corresponds to DMA channel n. 0 = no effect. 1 = aborts DMA operations on channel n.

register.name: CFG
register.description: Configuration register for DMA channel .

field.name: PERIPHREQEN
field.description: Peripheral request Enable. If a DMA channel is used to perform a memory-to-memory move, any peripheral DMA request associated with that channel can be disabled to prevent any interaction between the peripheral and the DMA controller.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Peripheral DMA requests are disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Peripheral DMA requests are enabled.

field.name: HWTRIGEN
field.description: Hardware Triggering Enable for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Hardware triggering is not used.

field.name: TRIGPOL
field.description: Trigger Polarity. Selects the polarity of a hardware trigger for this channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_LOW_FALLING
enumeratedValue.description: Active low - falling edge. Hardware trigger is active low or falling edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

enumeratedValue.name: ACTIVE_HIGH_RISING
enumeratedValue.description: Active high - rising edge. Hardware trigger is active high or rising edge triggered, based on TRIGTYPE.

field.name: TRIGTYPE
field.description: Trigger Type. Selects hardware trigger as edge triggered or level triggered.

enumeratedValue.name: EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Edge. Hardware trigger is edge triggered. Transfers will be initiated and completed, as specified for a single trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Level. Hardware trigger is level triggered. Note that when level triggering without burst (BURSTPOWER = 0) is selected, only hardware triggers should be used on that channel. Transfers continue as long as the trigger level is asserted. Once the trigger is de-asserted, the transfer will be paused until the trigger is, again, asserted. However, the transfer will not be paused until any remaining transfers within the current BURSTPOWER length are completed.

field.name: TRIGBURST
field.description: Trigger Burst. Selects whether hardware triggers cause a single or burst transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: SINGLE
enumeratedValue.description: Single transfer. Hardware trigger causes a single transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: BURST
enumeratedValue.description: Burst transfer. When the trigger for this channel is set to edge triggered, a hardware trigger causes a burst transfer, as defined by BURSTPOWER. When the trigger for this channel is set to level triggered, a hardware trigger causes transfers to continue as long as the trigger is asserted, unless the transfer is complete.

field.name: BURSTPOWER
field.description: Burst Power is used in two ways. It always selects the address wrap size when SRCBURSTWRAP and/or DSTBURSTWRAP modes are selected (see descriptions elsewhere in this register). When the TRIGBURST field elsewhere in this register = 1, Burst Power selects how many transfers are performed for each DMA trigger. This can be used, for example, with peripherals that contain a FIFO that can initiate a DMA operation when the FIFO reaches a certain level. 0000: Burst size = 1 (20). 0001: Burst size = 2 (21). 0010: Burst size = 4 (22). 1010: Burst size = 1024 (210). This corresponds to the maximum supported transfer count. others: not supported. The total transfer length as defined in the XFERCOUNT bits in the XFERCFG register must be an even multiple of the burst size.

field.name: SRCBURSTWRAP
field.description: Source Burst Wrap. When enabled, the source data address for the DMA is 'wrapped', meaning that the source address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to read several sequential registers from a peripheral for each DMA burst, reading the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Source burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Source burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: DSTBURSTWRAP
field.description: Destination Burst Wrap. When enabled, the destination data address for the DMA is 'wrapped', meaning that the destination address range for each burst will be the same. As an example, this could be used to write several sequential registers to a peripheral for each DMA burst, writing the same registers again for each burst.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Destination burst wrapping is not enabled for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Destination burst wrapping is enabled for this DMA channel.

field.name: CHPRIORITY
field.description: Priority of this channel when multiple DMA requests are pending. Eight priority levels are supported: 0x0 = highest priority. 0x7 = lowest priority.

register.name: CTLSTAT
register.description: Control and status register for DMA channel .

field.name: VALIDPENDING
field.description: Valid pending flag for this channel. This bit is set when a 1 is written to the corresponding bit in the related SETVALID register when CFGVALID = 1 for the same channel.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. No effect on DMA operation.

field.name: TRIG
field.description: Trigger flag. Indicates that the trigger for this channel is currently set. This bit is cleared at the end of an entire transfer or upon reload when CLRTRIG = 1.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Not triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is not set. DMA operations will not be carried out.

enumeratedValue.name: TRIGGERED
enumeratedValue.description: Triggered. The trigger for this DMA channel is set. DMA operations will be carried out.

register.name: XFERCFG
register.description: Transfer configuration register for DMA channel .

field.name: CFGVALID
field.description: Configuration Valid flag. This bit indicates whether the current channel descriptor is valid and can potentially be acted upon, if all other activation criteria are fulfilled.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Not valid. The channel descriptor is not considered valid until validated by an associated SETVALID0 setting.

enumeratedValue.name: VALID
enumeratedValue.description: Valid. The current channel descriptor is considered valid.

field.name: RELOAD
field.description: Indicates whether the channel's control structure will be reloaded when the current descriptor is exhausted. Reloading allows ping-pong and linked transfers.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. Do not reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. Reload the channels' control structure when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SWTRIG
field.description: Software Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_SET
enumeratedValue.description: Not set. When written by software, the trigger for this channel is not set. A new trigger, as defined by the HWTRIGEN, TRIGPOL, and TRIGTYPE will be needed to start the channel.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. When written by software, the trigger for this channel is set immediately. This feature should not be used with level triggering when TRIGBURST = 0.

field.name: CLRTRIG
field.description: Clear Trigger.

enumeratedValue.name: NOT_CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Not cleared. The trigger is not cleared when this descriptor is exhausted. If there is a reload, the next descriptor will be started.

enumeratedValue.name: CLEARED
enumeratedValue.description: Cleared. The trigger is cleared when this descriptor is exhausted

field.name: SETINTA
field.description: Set Interrupt flag A for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTA flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: SETINTB
field.description: Set Interrupt flag B for this channel. There is no hardware distinction between interrupt A and B. They can be used by software to assist with more complex descriptor usage. By convention, interrupt A may be used when only one interrupt flag is needed.

enumeratedValue.name: SET
enumeratedValue.description: Set. The INTB flag for this channel will be set when the current descriptor is exhausted.

field.name: WIDTH
field.description: Transfer width used for this DMA channel.

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_8
enumeratedValue.description: 8-bit. 8-bit transfers are performed (8-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_16
enumeratedValue.description: 16-bit. 6-bit transfers are performed (16-bit source reads and destination writes).

enumeratedValue.name: BIT_32
enumeratedValue.description: 32-bit. 32-bit transfers are performed (32-bit source reads and destination writes).

field.name: SRCINC
field.description: Determines whether the source address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The source address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The source address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the source is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The source address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The source address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: DSTINC
field.description: Determines whether the destination address is incremented for each DMA transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_INCREMENT
enumeratedValue.description: No increment. The destination address is not incremented for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is a peripheral device.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_1
enumeratedValue.description: 1 x width. The destination address is incremented by the amount specified by Width for each transfer. This is the usual case when the destination is memory.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_2
enumeratedValue.description: 2 x width. The destination address is incremented by 2 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

enumeratedValue.name: WIDTH_X_4
enumeratedValue.description: 4 x width. The destination address is incremented by 4 times the amount specified by Width for each transfer.

field.name: XFERCOUNT
field.description: Total number of transfers to be performed, minus 1 encoded. The number of bytes transferred is: (XFERCOUNT + 1) x data width (as defined by the WIDTH field). The DMA controller uses this bit field during transfer to count down. Hence, it cannot be used by software to read back the size of the transfer, for instance, in an interrupt handler. 0x0 = a total of 1 transfer will be performed. 0x1 = a total of 2 transfers will be performed. 0x3FF = a total of 1,024 transfers will be performed.

register.name: B0_0
register.description: Byte pin registers for all port 0 and 1 GPIO pins

field.name: PBYTE
field.description: Read: state of the pin PIOm_n, regardless of direction, masking, or alternate function, except that pins configured as analog I/O always read as 0. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. Write: loads the pin's output bit. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package.

register.name: W0_0
register.description: Word pin registers for all port 0 and 1 GPIO pins

field.name: PWORD
field.description: Read 0: pin PIOm_n is LOW. Write 0: clear output bit. Read 0xFFFF FFFF: pin PIOm_n is HIGH. Write any value 0x0000 0001 to 0xFFFF FFFF: set output bit. Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package.

Only 0 or 0xFFFF FFFF can be read. Writing any value other than 0 will set the output bit. One register for each port pin. Supported pins depends on the specific device and package.

register.description: Word pin registers for all port 0 and 1 GPIO pins

register.name: DIR0
register.description: Direction registers

field.name: DIRP
field.description: Selects pin direction for pin PIOm_n (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = input. 1 = output.

register.name: MASK0
register.description: Mask register

field.name: MASKP
field.description: Controls which bits corresponding to PIOm_n are active in the MPORT register (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read MPORT: pin state; write MPORT: load output bit. 1 = Read MPORT: 0; write MPORT: output bit not affected.

register.name: PIN0
register.description: Port pin register

field.name: PORT
field.description: Reads pin states or loads output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read: pin is low; write: clear output bit. 1 = Read: pin is high; write: set output bit.

register.name: MPIN0
register.description: Masked port register

field.name: MPORTP
field.description: Masked port register (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read: pin is LOW and/or the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 1; write: clear output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0. 1 = Read: pin is HIGH and the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0; write: set output bit if the corresponding bit in the MASK register is 0.

register.name: SET0
register.description: Write: Set register for port Read: output bits for port

field.name: SETP
field.description: Read or set output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = Read: output bit: write: no operation. 1 = Read: output bit; write: set output bit.

register.name: CLR0
register.description: Clear port

field.name: CLRP
field.description: Clear output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = No operation. 1 = Clear output bit.

register.name: NOT0
register.description: Toggle port

field.name: NOTP
field.description: Toggle output bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = no operation. 1 = Toggle output bit.

register.name: DIRSET0
register.description: Set pin direction bits for port

field.name: DIRSETP
field.description: Set direction bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = No operation. 1 = Set direction bit.

register.name: DIRCLR0
register.description: Clear pin direction bits for port

field.name: DIRCLRP
field.description: Clear direction bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = No operation. 1 = Clear direction bit.

register.name: DIRNOT0
register.description: Toggle pin direction bits for port

field.name: DIRNOTP
field.description: Toggle direction bits (bit 0 = PIOn_0, bit 1 = PIOn_1, etc.). Supported pins depends on the specific device and package. 0 = no operation. 1 = Toggle direction bit.

peripheral.name: PINT
peripheral.description: LPC82x Pin interrupt and pattern match (PINT)

register.name: ISEL
register.description: Pin Interrupt Mode register

field.name: PMODE
field.description: Selects the interrupt mode for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Edge sensitive 1 = Level sensitive

register.name: IENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENRL
field.description: Enables the rising edge or level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: SIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level or rising edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENR, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Enable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: CIENR
register.description: Pin interrupt level (rising edge interrupt) clear register

field.name: CENRL
field.description: Ones written to this address clear bits in the IENR, thus disabling the interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENR register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Disable rising edge or level interrupt.

register.name: IENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt enable register

field.name: ENAF
field.description: Enables the falling edge or configures the active level interrupt for each pin interrupt. Bit n configures the pin interrupt selected in PINTSELn. 0 = Disable falling edge interrupt or set active interrupt level LOW. 1 = Enable falling edge interrupt enabled or set active interrupt level HIGH.

register.name: SIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt set register

field.name: SETENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address set bits in the IENF, thus enabling interrupts. Bit n sets bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = Select HIGH-active interrupt or enable falling edge interrupt.

register.name: CIENF
register.description: Pin interrupt active level or falling edge interrupt clear register

field.name: CENAF
field.description: Ones written to this address clears bits in the IENF, thus disabling interrupts. Bit n clears bit n in the IENF register. 0 = No operation. 1 = LOW-active interrupt selected or falling edge interrupt disabled.

register.name: RISE
register.description: Pin interrupt rising edge register

field.name: RDET
field.description: Rising edge detect. Bit n detects the rising edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No rising edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a rising edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear rising edge detection for this pin.

register.name: FALL
register.description: Pin interrupt falling edge register

field.name: FDET
field.description: Falling edge detect. Bit n detects the falling edge of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: No falling edge has been detected on this pin since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: a falling edge has been detected since Reset or the last time a one was written to this bit. Write 1: clear falling edge detection for this pin.

register.name: IST
register.description: Pin interrupt status register

field.name: PSTAT
field.description: Pin interrupt status. Bit n returns the status, clears the edge interrupt, or inverts the active level of the pin selected in PINTSELn. Read 0: interrupt is not being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 0: no operation. Read 1: interrupt is being requested for this interrupt pin. Write 1 (edge-sensitive): clear rising- and falling-edge detection for this pin. Write 1 (level-sensitive): switch the active level for this pin (in the IENF register).

register.name: PMCTRL
register.description: Pattern match interrupt control register

field.name: SEL_PMATCH
field.description: Specifies whether the 8 pin interrupts are controlled by the pin interrupt function or by the pattern match function.

enumeratedValue.name: PIN_INTERRUPT
enumeratedValue.description: Pin interrupt. Interrupts are driven in response to the standard pin interrupt function.

enumeratedValue.name: PATTERN_MATCH
enumeratedValue.description: Pattern match. Interrupts are driven in response to pattern matches.

field.name: ENA_RXEV
field.description: Enables the RXEV output to the CPU and/or to a GPIO output when the specified boolean expression evaluates to true.

enumeratedValue.name: DISABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Disabled. RXEV output to the CPU is disabled.

enumeratedValue.name: ENABLED
enumeratedValue.description: Enabled. RXEV output to the CPU is enabled.

field.name: PMAT
field.description: This field displays the current state of pattern matches. A 1 in any bit of this field indicates that the corresponding product term is matched by the current state of the appropriate inputs.

register.name: PMSRC
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit-slice source register

field.name: SRC0
field.description: Selects the input source for bit slice 0

enumeratedValue.description: Input 0. Selects the pin selected in the PINTSEL0 register as the source to bit slice 0.

register.name: PMCFG
register.description: Pattern match interrupt bit slice configuration register

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS0
field.description: Determines whether slice 0 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 0 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 0 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 0 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS1
field.description: Determines whether slice 1 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 1 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 1 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 1 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS2
field.description: Determines whether slice 2 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 2 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 2 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 2 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS3
field.description: Determines whether slice 3 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 3 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 3 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 3 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS4
field.description: Determines whether slice 4 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 4 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 4 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 4 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS5
field.description: Determines whether slice 5 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 5 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 5 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 5 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: PROD_ENDPTS6
field.description: Determines whether slice 6 is an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: NO_EFFECT
enumeratedValue.description: No effect. Slice 6 is not an endpoint.

enumeratedValue.name: ENDPOINT
enumeratedValue.description: endpoint. Slice 6 is the endpoint of a product term (minterm). Pin interrupt 6 in the NVIC is raised if the minterm evaluates as true.

field.name: CFG0
field.description: Specifies the match contribution condition for bit slice 0.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_HIGH
enumeratedValue.description: Constant HIGH. This bit slice always contributes to a product term match.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising edge. Match occurs if a rising edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky falling edge. Match occurs if a falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: STICKY_RISING_FALLING_EDGE
enumeratedValue.description: Sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs if either a rising or falling edge on the specified input has occurred since the last time the edge detection for this bit slice was cleared. This bit is only cleared when the PMCFG or the PMSRC registers are written to.

enumeratedValue.name: HIGH_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: High level. Match (for this bit slice) occurs when there is a high level on the input specified for this bit slice in the PMSRC register.

enumeratedValue.name: LOW_LEVEL
enumeratedValue.description: Low level. Match occurs when there is a low level on the specified input.

enumeratedValue.name: CONSTANT_ZERO
enumeratedValue.description: Constant 0. This bit slice never contributes to a match (should be used to disable any unused bit slices).

enumeratedValue.name: EVENT
enumeratedValue.description: Event. Non-sticky rising or falling edge. Match occurs on an event - i.e. when either a rising or falling edge is first detected on the specified input (this is a non-sticky version of value 0x3) . This bit is cleared after one clock cycle.
